div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 205 Chalcis (or Boeotia), before 1958 Burial: late 3rd cent. B.C. ? (T) Contents: c. 222 AR Lot A Alexander III: 2 dr. (Asia Minor mints) Philip III: 1 dr. (Colophon) Locri Opuntii: 6 triob. Boeotia: 37 triob. Chalcis: 36 dr.; 5 triob. Lot B Alexander III: 12 dr. (Asia Minor mints) Demetrius Poliorcetes: 5 triob. Lysimachus: 1 dr. (Alex. type) Phocis: 15 triob. Locri Opuntii: 16 triob. Boeotia: 29 triob. Carystus: 3 dr. Chalcis: 15 dr. Euboean League: 27 dr. Histiaea: 5 dr. Rhodes: 6 dr.; triob. Unc.: 1 triob. Disposition: M. Wallace, Toronto (Lot A); unknown (Lot B) Lot A was purchased by W. P. Wallace c. 1958 from a European dealer. Lot B was offered to him a few years later by an Athenian dealer who had had the hd. for some time. The similarity of contents suggests a com- mon source. Photos of both lots are on file in the ANS
